page.title: 17BOBBIN LACE WEAVING,S IN A.
page.content: In Victorian times bobbin lace was woven in their homes by poor women and children,often as young as 5,in an attempt to earn extra money.Today,you can see beautiful examples of this craft in Brussels.It is quite easy to master the craft.All you need are card,steel,pins,wire,scissors and beads.Traditionally bobbins are spangled to weigh and tension the lace and to allow for individual designs.It is still taught in village schools but my mother learnt at a Sutton Centre night class.She is a member of the Lace Society where she can see lace made,displayed and buy materials.She has made lace collars,bookmarks,table mats and paperweights.
